page.title: 15Brereton Heath Park (cont).
page.content: The Heath and Woodland is crossed by many footpaths and bridlepaths on which many people take their{exercise both on foot and on horseback.Here they can enjoy the wide variety of the {flora and fauna.}Circling the lake on one of these paths,one can view the water most of the time, on which large varieties of waterbird and wader come in to feed. Due to the popularity of the Park, it has introduced a tremendous volume of{traffic}to the area especially at the weekends.This has produced problems for local farmers during Summer months, when they have been trying to get passed the Quarry area with loaded tractors and have been thwarted by the parked cars which are usually on both sides of the road.
